a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality. Suicide
deaths are underreported in many countries due to social stigma and cultural or legal concerns. This data is
adjusted for this underreporting to estimate the actual rate of suicides.
Data source: WHO, Global Health Observatory (2022); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2023)
Note: Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per
capita. The suicide rate is age-standardized.
